abstract: For many organisms, chemical signals and cues play a big role in determining who eats whom, who mates with whom and who wins in competitive interactions.
snippet: For many organisms, chemical signals and cues play a big role in determining who eats whom, who mates with whom and who wins in competitive interactions.
lead_paragraph: Mark Hay, a biology professor at Georgia Tech, writes from Fiji, where he is investigating coral-seaweed competition in the coral reefs.

headline.main: Chemistry as the Language of Life
